Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for sophomore, junior, and seniors in the Acting track.
Add Consent: Instructor Consent Required
title: SoC THEATRE 243-2-21 Acting I: Principles of Characterization

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In the sophomore year the theme is "Principles of Characterization" beginning with sensory awareness and observation. We will examine the process of acting, and continue to explore the presentation of self and character on stage. Students will participate in exercises to expand their physical, vocal, and imaginative expression. Our work in the winter quarter will further pursue the stimulation of the actor's imagination. We will continue and build off of the observation work of the fall quarter, by allowing what we observe to stimulate imaginative leaps in characterization and actor's analysis. We will respond to other artistic stimuli (photography, art, literature) as a basis for character creation. We will continue to seek insight into various aspects of human nature and the human experience. The fundamentals of our work will include: Ensemble Building, Sensory Perception and Response, Observation, Imagination, Dramatic Character Creation, and Text Analysis.
